intro: Linanthus androsaceus, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Linanthus androsaceus is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
